cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest through the Bahamas, forecast to parallel the Florida east coast this weekend, then accelerate north-northeast along or just inland of the U.S. East Coast toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the east-central Florida coast (around Boca Raton – Volusia/Brevard County line)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hallandale Beach FL northward to Ponte Vedra Beach FL (tropical storm/hurricane watches)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Boca Raton FL to Volusia/Brevard County Line FL and the Central/Northwestern Bahamas (hurricane warning); North of Ocean Reef to south of Boca Raton FL (tropical-storm warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from Florida to Maine expected to experience some effects as the storm lifts northward
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible but not certain (forecast 2–4 inches with isolated 6 inches)
weather_observation.wind: Low (10%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions with gusts 30–40 mph possible Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected above 3 ft in the Delaware River/Upper Delaware Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could deliver 2–4 inches with isolated higher totals Tuesday–Wednesday, causing localized urban and river flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High tributary currents and elevated Delaware River levels may hamper vessel handling; brief visibility reductions in squalls; possible schedule disruption due to precautionary port readiness measures
